page.title: 19BALDON HOUSE, MARSH BALDON
page.content: Since we first came to Baldon House 30 years ago, many changes have taken place. In those days it was a 'Country Gentleman's Private Estate' with a big staff inside and out,horses,cattle,tied cottages and a kitchen garden which supplied all needs. In winter the local Hunt met on the front lawn,and in summer there were fetes and horse shows. Alas,due to economic circumstances,it is now very different. From being the 'Big House' it is three establishments. The old garage and grain store is now a modern house,the owners coming from London. The West Wing is converted into another unit occupied by an American family. The original owner lives in the middle. The staff has been reduced, and the fields leased to a local farmer. The woods and lake remain the same but permits are required for fishing.
